title: Belagavi-Born Technologist Sachin Katti Named Intel's Chief Technology & AI Officer
summary: Sachin Katti, an alumnus of St. Xavier's High School in Belagavi, has been appointed as Intel's Chief Technology and AI Officer, succeeding Greg Lavender. With degrees from IIT Bombay and MIT, Katti will lead Intel's AI strategy, product roadmap, and Intel Labs while managing relationships with startup and developer ecosystems.
content:
Sachin Katti, who hails from Belagavi and is an alumnus of St. Xavier's High School, has been appointed to one of the highest positions at Intel, succeeding Greg Lavender, who is retiring. This appointment marks a significant achievement for both the Indian diaspora and the Belagavi community.

Katti's educational journey began in Belagavi, followed by a B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering from IIT Bombay. He subsequently earned his M.S. and Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences from MIT in 2005 and 2009 respectively. He has established himself as a pioneer in networking systems and wireless technologies.

In his previous role at Intel, Katti led the networking chip division and drove innovation in connectivity solutions. According to Lip-Bu Tan's internal memo, Katti will now lead Intel's overall AI strategy and product roadmap, while also overseeing Intel Labs and relationships with startup and developer ecosystems.

As CTO and AI chief, Katti's responsibilities will include steering Intel's initiatives in generative AI, high-performance computing, and edge solutions. His appointment is seen as strategic as Intel works to strengthen its position in the AI chip market, where competitors like Nvidia currently lead.

For Belagavi residents, Katti's journey from St. Xavier's to Silicon Valley serves as an inspiration, highlighting the impact of dedication, intellect, and strong educational foundations.

content.content:
Byuday

April 18, 2025

Katti, who hails from Belagavi and is an alumnus of St. Xavier’s High School, now joins the highest ranks at Intel, succeeding Greg Lavender, who is retiring. This marks a moment of immense pride not only for the Indian diaspora but especially for the Belagavi community.

🧠 A Mind Shaped in Belagavi, Polished GloballyAfter his schooling in Belagavi, Sachin Katti went on to complete his B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering from the prestigious IIT Bombay. He then earned his M.S. and Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), graduating in 2005 and 2009 respectively. Over the years, he has carved a reputation as a pioneer in networking systems and wireless technologies.

At Intel, Sachin Katti previously led the networking chip division and was instrumental in driving innovation across Intel’s connectivity solutions. His promotion is seen as a strategic move, as Intel seeks to regain lost ground in AI chips where competitors like Nvidia currently dominate.

🚀 Leading Intel’s AI FutureLip-Bu Tan, in his internal memo, expressed full confidence in Katti’s capabilities:“Katti is expanding his responsibilities to include the role of chief technology and AI officer for the company. As part of this, he will lead our overall AI strategy and AI product roadmap, as well as Intel Labs and our relationships with the startup and developer ecosystems.”

As CTO and AI chief, Katti will steer Intel’s push into generative AI, high-performance computing, and edge solutions — areas that will define the next decade of computing. His leadership will also extend to Intel Labs, the innovation nerve center of the company, as well as its outreach to startups and the developer community.

🌍 Local Boy, Global ImpactFor the people of Belagavi, Sachin Katti’s journey is nothing short of inspirational. From the classrooms of St. Xavier’s to the boardrooms of Silicon Valley, he exemplifies what dedication, intellect, and a strong educational foundation can achieve. His rise to one of the most critical roles in the tech industry is a reminder of the city’s quiet but impactful contribution to India’s global talent pool.

As the AI revolution gains momentum, all eyes will be on Intel — and by extension, on Katti — to see how the tech giant reinvents itself under his vision.

So proud to see our student Sachin Katti from St Xavier’s High School, Belgaum take on the role of Chief Technology and AI Officer at Intel! I still remember him as an extraordinary student during his school days always curious, always hungry to learn more. He had a natural brilliance and a passion for knowledge that set him apart. Consistently standing first in class, he was never one to settle always pushing boundaries even back then.Wishing him continued success in this incredible journey!
